bibl.idno: The Philip S. Hench Walter Reed/Yellow Fever Collection [manuscript] / [collected by] Philip S. Hench ; HEALTHSCI MS-1.

bibl.title: Letter from H. Carter Redd to Philip Showalter Hench, April 19, 1948

div1.p: Redd informs Hench that he may keep the Carter materials as long as he wishes, and that Redd will look over the Carter photographs and send appropriate ones. Redd knows of only two Walter Reed letters in the materials.

div1.head: Letter from H. Carter Redd to Philip Showalter Hench, April 19, 1948
div1.opener:
Commissioner of Accounts and Commissioner in
Chancery of Circuit Court of Hanover County
H. CARTER REDD
ATTORNEY-AT-LAW
1104 TRAVELERS BUILDING
RICHMOND, VA.
April 19th, 1948
Dr. Philip S. Hench
Mayo Clinic
Rochester, Minn.
My dear Dr. Hench:
div1.p:
You may keep the papers and trunk as long as you
want them. I will look over the photographs and see
if there is anything taken in duplicateCuba or Panama and
if there are such, I will be glad to send them to
you.

The only letters from Dr. Reed, or from Dr.
Carter to Dr. Reed, other than which you may find
in the trunks, are the two; copies of which I have
already sent you and the originals of which I have
in my safe in Ashland.
div1.closer: Sincerely yours, H. Carter Redd HCR:jh
